title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
nilsteampassnet/teampass prior to 3.0.7 is vulnerable to cross site scripting (XSS) from item names within a folder.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2516
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/teampass/commit/39b774cba118ca5383b0a51a71b1e7dea2761927
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/19470f0b-7094-4339-8d4a-4b5570b54716
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2ffp-w665-9mgx
items.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] Cross Site Scripting in nilsteampassnet/teampass

items.content_html:

items.content_html:
A malformed title in the feed widget of craftcms/cms can deliver an XSS payload. This has been resolved in this commit.

References

  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/security/advisories/GHSA-j4mx-98hw-6rv6
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/commit/52bd161614620edbab2d24d078ca9ebca2528442

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-31144
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4mx-98hw-6rv6
items.title: [craftcms/cms] craftcms/cms vulnerable to cross site scripting in RSS feed widget

items.content_html:
The request rate limiting feature on the login page of AzuraCast before version 0.18.3 can be bypassed, which could allow an attacker to brute force login credentials.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2531
  • https://github.com/azuracast/azuracast/commit/bdb23594ad3e0c47c8568ce028a7c244a406cf9d
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/20463eb2-0f9d-4ea3-a2c8-93f80e7aca02
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4m7v-wr6v-2mw5
items.title: [azuracast/azuracast] AzuraCast missing brute force prevention

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.2 is vulnerable to Stored XSS on Tags on uploaded files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28476
  • https://concretecms.com
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2023-04-20
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2ggc-552c-rmqr
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Stored cross site scripting on tags

items.content_html:
The vulnerability was found Moodle which exists due to insufficient sanitization of user-supplied data in external Wiki method for listing pages. A remote attacker can send a specially crafted request to the affected application and execute limited SQL commands within the application database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30944
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2188606
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=446286
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-77187
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/5521d1d6e8bb8bebb76ad8154095f6b18ea26e7f
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7mmc-22g7-3xq2
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle SQL Injection vulnerability

items.content_html:
The vulnerability was found Moodle which exists because the application allows a user to control path of the older to create in TinyMCE loaders. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request and create arbitrary folders on the system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30943
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2188605
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=446285
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-77718
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/59d42e1ed23f916dcb47d53c745bef18a116d800
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-22gj-8qj2-fj46
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle External Control of File Name or Path vulnerability

items.content_html:
RosarioSIS 10.8.4 is vulnerable to CSV injection via the Periods Module.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-29918
  • https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JAhJOlfKKD5Y5zEKo0_8a3A-nQ7Dz_GIMmlXmOvXV48/edit?usp=sharing
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f8hp-grmr-pp7j
items.title: [francoisjacquet/rosariosis] RosarioSIS vulnerable to CSV Injection

items.content_html:
Impact

The impact of this path traversal and arbitrary extension is limited (creation of arbitrary files and appending data to existing files) but when combined with the SQL Injection, the exported data RESTRICTED DIFFUSION 9 / 9 can be controlled and a webshell can be uploaded. Attackers can use that to execute arbitrary PHP code on the server with the permissions of the webserver.

Patches

Update to version 10.5.18 or apply this patch manually https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/7f788fa44bc18bc1c9182c25e26b770a1d30b62f.patch

Workarounds

Apply patch https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/7f788fa44bc18bc1c9182c25e26b770a1d30b62f.patch manually.

References

https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/pull/14498

References

  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/security/advisories/GHSA-g2mc-fqqc-hxg3
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/pull/14498
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/7f788fa44bc18bc1c9182c25e26b770a1d30b62f.patch
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30855
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/f1d904094700b513c4756904fa2b1e19d08d890e.patch
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g2mc-fqqc-hxg3
items.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Pimcore Path Traversal Vulnerability in AdminBundle/Controller/Reports/CustomReportController.php

items.content_html:
phpMyFAQ prior to 3.1.13 has a stored cross site scripting vulnerability in name field in add question module. This allows an attacker to steal user cookies.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2428
  • https://github.com/thorsten/phpmyfaq/commit/0a4980d870bac92df945f6d022726c4e3ed584ab
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/cee65b6d-b003-4e6a-9d14-89aa94bee43e
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8595-6653-96p2
items.title: [thorsten/phpmyfaq] phpMyFAQ vulnerable to Stored Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
In AVideo, a normal user can make a Meeting Schedule where the user can invite another user in that Meeting, but I found out that it did not properly sanitize the malicious characters when creating a Meeting Room. This leads the attacker to put malicious scripts.

Impact:

Since any USER including the ADMIN can see the meeting room that was created by the attacker this can lead to cookie hijacking and takeover of any accounts without user interaction.

Step to Reproduce:

  1. As normal USER go to Meet -> Schedule

https://demo.avideo.com/plugin/Meet/

  1. In "Meet topic" field put XSS payload

Example: "><img src=x onerror=alert('Pawned+by+Gonz')>

  1. Then click Save

  2. Now as ADMIN go to Meet -> Schedule -> Upcoming

https://demo.avideo.com/plugin/Meet/

  1. Then the XSS payload that normal USER created will be executed

Video POC: https://youtu.be/Nke0Bmv5F-o

References

  • https://github.com/WWBN/AVideo/security/advisories/GHSA-xr9h-p2rc-rpqm
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30860
  • https://youtu.be/Nke0Bmv5F-o
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xr9h-p2rc-rpqm
items.title: [wwbn/avideo] WWBN/AVideo stored XSS vulnerability leads to takeover of any user's account, including admin's account

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.1 did not have a rate limit for password resets.

items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Missing rate limit for password resets

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.1 is vulnerable to stored XSS in RSS Displayer via the href attribute because the link element input was not sanitized.
